fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-220].
  {panel}

Identify and flag gaps between release end and next release start when start is dynamically scheduled

Scenario:
* The first release has a fixed end date. Subsequent releases have dynamically scheduled start dates and fixed end dates.
* When the start dates are dynamically scheduled there may be a gap between the previous release end and the start of the next release. 
** The start of the subsequent releases is based on the finish date of the release and how many sprints it will take to complete the release. 
** The start does not necessarily come immediately after the end of the previous release, potentially leaving a gap of one or more days. 

It would be good if JIRA Portfolio could identify gaps between the fixed end date of one release and the dynamic start date of the subsequent release so that I may choose to address these gaps or ignore them.
* A possible solution would be adding a small indicator type icon next to the date, indicating a gap is present.
fields.summary: Identify and flag gaps between release end and next release start when start is dynamically scheduled
JIRA Portfolio should have a separate log file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-218].
  {panel}

Theme Target should not be automatically adjusted to add up to 100% as this is usually not correct and users are almost unable to readjust them.

Suggestion is to let users set targets manually and:
# notify them if the aggregate is not 100%
# give them a button that will automatically adjust the targets when clicked on
fields.summary: Better handling Theme Target settings

fields.description:
Hi
The automatic scheduling of stories, epics, initiatives in the Portolofio plugin does not allow currently to change the assignments  to the sprint, releases manually .

Is there a plan to allow this in the near future? This is important to not work again in the individual product backlogs
Thank you
Florina
fields.summary: Automatic assignemnt of stories vs. manual changing them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-204].
  {panel}

I saw JPO-75, but it was not clear as to what behaviour it was specifically related to. In 1.8.4 this behaviour appears to be present through the "Import Issues" button and as such is Resolved; unless I have misunderstood?

As Epics can be added through JIRA Agile but they don't appear until a manual "Import Issues" is performed, in my opinion I believe there is a significant opportunity for Epics to be missed. 

Ideally, the regular "Update from date..." operation would also identify new Epics in the Project(s) and suggest importing them into the plan. This provides a cue for a Product Owner to:
* Review the validity of those Epics
* Question the origin of those Epics (E.g. in organisations where project input should be funnelled through the PO).
* Identify the priority of those new Epics and re-plan accordingly.

Apologies if I have misunderstood Portfolio or it's behaviour.

Many Thanks,
Alex
fields.summary: Suggest import of new JIRA Agile Epics when using "Update from date..."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-203].
  {panel}

Scenario: 
There is an epic with several child stories in JIRA. Some of them have estimates, others are unestimated. 

In Portfolio, only the Epic is imported, which is sufficient to see the aggregated status/progress. 
However, displaying the ratio of unestimated items does not work in this case, as it only considers stories that are imported into Portfolio. 

expected: Take the same stories that are aggregated for the progress reporting and determine unestimated items based on issues without an original and remaining estimate on them.
fields.summary: "Display ratio of unestimated items" does not work when importing an epic without child stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-198].
  {panel}

We are now using Portfolio to plan a cross-team roadmap and have discovered an issue with importing stories into an Epic.

We use Epics to describe each Feature (and grouped into higher Initiatives) and the Epic can be worked on by one or more teams.  Our process working with Epics and Stories via Portfolio goes as follows.

1. Epics are defined in JIRA
2. Epics are imported into Portfolio
3. Epic estimates are entered into Portfolio representing the best guess per team to allow long-term planning.
4. As each Epic is further defined and gets closer to the top of the plan, the teams created their stories (in JIRA) under the Epic
5. The teams then estimate and allocate story points to the stories (in JIRA)
6. Once all teams have created and pointed all stories for the Epic, they are imported into Portfolio, replacing all Epic estimates with the total of the story points.

We have discovered a problem between steps 4,5 and 6 above.  If we ask the teams to create stories and before step 6 is complete and Update plan is run, Portfolio will try to replace the Epic estimate with 0, which I presume is the total of all stories.

For example:
*Epic impacts App and Server teams
*Epic estimates are App(20), Server (30)
*Server team add 3 stories under the Epic (no points)
* Update plan is run and all Epic estimates are replaced with 0

Is this expected behaviour (and therefore a problem with our process) or a bug?
fields.summary: Epic estimates overwritten on import by un-estimated stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-191].
  {panel}

I'm not sure if Atlassian can help with this, or if I should lodge this issue elsewhere.

We use the Tempo plugin on JIRA & Portfolio for recording time spent on tasks.  Unfortunately, the Tempo Tracker hides the Portfolio view schedule options (the cog) at bottom right of the Epics and Initiatives screens - see attached screenshots.

Currently, I have to switch off the tracker if I want to see these different schedule displays, then I have to manually update my worklog afterwards.

Can anything be done about this?
fields.summary: Tempo Tracker hides Portfolio view schedule options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-190].
  {panel}

When using Kanban team plan, there have been a number of instances when Portfolio suggests both a release Start Date and End Date in the past, which is impossible to achieve.

Some specific instances when this occurred were:

1. On 18 Nov 2014, imported issue into epic, selected 'release name - calculate' when importing.  Start and End Dates were returned as 3 Nov 2014 and 6 Nov 2014 respectively. Note that the imported JIRA issue did not have any due dates on it.

2. On 22 Jan 2015, clicking 'Calculate' in the Release drop-down menu in either an Epic or Initiative returned Start Date of 3 Nov 2014 and End Date of 3 Nov 2014.

In both cases, the jobs were small - a matter of 3-5 hours. It's curious that both examples returned 3 Nov 2014, although I'm not sure if this is a red herring?
fields.summary: 'Calculate release' returns a Start Date and End Date in the past

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-189].
  {panel}

Using Kanban team plan:

There have been a number of instances when the Report-Releases screen advises that some jobs cannot be done within the requested fixed period, at the same time that there are Free Capacities.  For example, a 14 hour job (comprised of 10 hours Back End Dev & 4 hours Technical Lead) displayed as a 14 hour overload (total amount of job) and being delivered after the fixed end date. At the same time, the card showed Free Capacities of Back End Dev, which doesn't make sense.

Atlassian suggested that rather than having separate stages for work type, eg, one stage for Design, another stage for Back End Dev, and another for Technical Lead etc, the calculation would probably work better if all work types were set up as different skills within one stage.  I have done this, but the problem described above still occurs.

Investigation into this issue would be greatly appreciated!
fields.summary: Free capacity in Kanban team plan does not work
Support archiving of releases

fields.description:
When we add new Epics to the backlog or re-prioritize existing ones , 
If we have releases that has expired (current date exceeds the release end date)

If we mark the release as "calculeated"  the algorithm still tries to allocate this in the release even if the release end date is in the past.

Currently the only solution we found is to remove the old releases from the portfolio  . 
But in that case we are loosing the historical data how many and which Epics/stories was completed in the old releases. 

Is it possible to "close" a release to not be used in the algorithm? 
Is there any other way to see historical data to learn about our estimations ? 
If we are doing something wrong let us know.

The "Test epic"  in the attached example is scheduled for December 2014 release which is in the past.
fields.summary: Old releases (where release end date is in the past) are still used in the Release calculation algorithm

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-186].
  {panel}

Progress Stories In Backlog are not marked in red when tracking exceeds the original estimation

In the first versions of the JIRA portfolio plugin  when  in a Story or Epic  the tracking hours exceed the original estimation the progress bar was labeled/marked in red . Now seems this feature is not available .  (Or at least I'm not able to see this now)

In our company (Ebay Enterprise) this is a derired feature . 
It is possible to fix this ? or at least provide a way to configure this?
fields.summary: Show progress of Stories in Backlog as red when tracking exceeds the original estimation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-185].
  {panel}

I'm now using Portfolio to plan a cross-team delivery using a combination of Initiatives, Epics and Stories.  Epic estimates are being used for some and stories and their estimates for others. 

As all teams are following Scrum and story points I have created one stage (Delivery) with a skill for each team (i.e. iOS, Server, Android).

I'm having an issue where an Epic is not scheduled in what I perceive to be the correct sprint.  Our priority Epics are in one (blue) release and are estimated across several teams, but as the screenshot shows, on one team the Epic is not scheduled until Sprint 6-7.

I have checked all settings in the plan, set minimum load of story points to 0 (for epics) and even reduced the large Epic estimate (36) to a low number, and the Epic always remains "stuck" in Sprint 6.

Could you please advise the logic used for the Schedule and why this is happening?  I'm very close to getting complete business buy-in to use Portfolio for planning and finally abandoning all the spreadsheets, and this seems to be the final hurdle.
fields.summary: Scheduling logic on the plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-166].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create two distinct Plans.
# Create a JIRA group {{read-plan}} and add a user to this group.
# In the Portfolio Global Permission, add the group {{read-plan}} in the permission {{JIRA Portfolio Viewer}}
# Open the both Plans, the permission should be shown as Read-only.
# Open one of the Plans, and edit Permissions at: Plan >> Configure >> Permissions.
# Add the group {{read-plan}} as "Editor".
# Test the permissions of the Plans, both plans will still being viewed as read-only.

h3. Expected Behaviour:

The permission configured directly in the Plan, should overwrite the Global Permission, giving the ability to grant granular permission levels depending on the Plan.

As a side note, this configuration will work if configured reverse, granting User permission in the Global permission, and then view permission in the plan, the Global Permission will respect the more restrictive.

If the user doesn't have any Global permission and you add a Plan permission, the plan permission isn't considered.
fields.summary: Plan level permissions should take precedence over global permission settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-161].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

fields.description:
Hello,

we use portfolio, but somthing does not fit into the general concept. Typicaly what we do is that we import backlog from given jira project nad version into Portfolio. If the estimates are in tickets everything works  fine. In case the estimates are missing we expect that we update estimate in single tickets (usualy done by the team in planning) which should be updated in the portfolio. 

We know that syncrhonization from portfolio to tickets is working but the xpectattion is to have it working in the second direction.

One another issue, which we don't understand is the following. What happens if the estiamte from ticket is not taken into portolio but there is progress on this ticket. How is the progress measured?
fields.summary: How to handle changes in backlogs and reflect this in portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-151].
  {panel}

I created 3 Release versions in a JIRA Portfolio plan.

Next I created a release stream called "Release Stream A"

When I created the stream, it asked if I wanted to move the existing Releases into the new stream or leave them in the default stream. I chose to leave them in default stream, but now I want to move 2 of the 3 into the "Release Stream A" and I can't.

Could you please implement this suggestion on a further release?

Thanks,
[~berntx]
fields.summary: Ability to move a Release between Streams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-150].
  {panel}

I use Portfolio to create plan in following way:
1. I create filter for jira product and verion -in general more than 100 issues in there. 
2. I import the issues, I select the filter and it shows 100 of 500.
3. The checkbox  Exclude already linked issues is checked but seams not to work.

I expect that after 5 runs of import the list should be empty as the checkbox:Exclude already linked issues is marked.

My questions/issues:
1. This looks like a bug or I use it in wrong way
2. How to handle 500 isues where I cannot limit it to 100,the onlylimitations on my filter is fixversion
fields.summary: Import limit message is wrong when excluding linked issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-149].
  {panel}

Currently when you have a parent issue that contains sub-task, when you import into JIRA Portfolio as backlog it won't show the estimates for the sub-task by itself.

*Example:*
# Create a parent issue in JIRA
# Set time tracking on this parent issue (estimate and remaining)
# Create a sub-task issue under this parent issue
# Import into JIRA Portfolio
# The estimate column for sub-task will not display under the backlog/plan view of JIRA Portfolio, nor will be considered when reporting.
fields.summary: sub-task inheritance on estimates when import as backlog
Backlog text search: Include issue keys
"Clear"-button (x) in the search box
Tooltips not dissappearing in Safari 7.1 and 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-141].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In cases where the same team works on different projects, managing that is not optimal. For example, any modifications must be replicated across all projects they belong to, which is susceptible to error.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to share teams across multiple projects
fields.summary: Shared teams across multiple plans
Visual Roadmap Gadget
Import of issues: allow to set an existing parent epic for all issues
Filter the graphical schedule by a date range
read team/member availability from another system

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-136].
  {panel}

[MIGRATED from uservoice]

I am very impressed by the scope of what your product brings to the planning process. However, I believe that if an EPIC is to be considering the primary top level planning unit, then I think your product is missing one important aspect - the facility to apply business value ratings to EPICS!

By this I mean having a facility to apply a business influence/value ratings to an EPIC - ideally across several different rating factors.

Examples of these business value attributes include: 
* Strategic value 
* Revenue influence 
* Cost of Sale influence 
* Cost of ownership influence 
* Risk

Put simply you could imagine having a facility to: 
* Define one or more business rating attributes 
* At an EPIC level allow numeric values to be assigned against each attribute 
* Extend your roadmap time view to include a horizontal band that shows how much business value is being delivered over time.
fields.summary: Applying business value ratings to EPICS
Provide the option to create subtasks of a story in JIRA for each stage defined
Option to assign members per stage
Allow to open the graphical schedule in a separate, full page
Pull in Business Value and use for initial priority ranking
Allow issue linking across projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-130].
  {panel}

[MIGRATED from uservoice]

Option to create multiple staging schemas (with different configuration of stages, skills, and how efforts are split up as a default resource allocation). 
Link staging schema to issue types

Motivation: Different types of issues will have different allocations of effort. A reusable schema would be helpful to avoid having to break down the estimates for each item individually.
fields.summary: Different stage/skill configurations for different issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-129].
  {panel}

[MIGRATED from uservoice]

Our high-level roadmap is actioned by several different teams, running their own backlog from their own Jira project. It would be great to see the estimates gathered from the "teams" which will implement this roadmap item.

Use case: 
1. There is a high-level roadmap story of "list all orders from the server and display on mobile apps"

2. The work to achieve this is split between server team, and 4 app teams (for iOS, Android, BB, and Windows).

3. When defining a "story" in the roadmap, the stages, skills and estimates are gathered from linking the story to various teams. (For example: A story is created that just requires iOS and Server, links are created to 2xiOS and 1xServer stories, and the estimates are calculated).

4. The roadmaps story can be linked to several stories in each of the 5 team's backlog

5. Progress is shown by collating all of the estimates (days/hours/story points).

6. Team/Stage/Skill capacity is calculated by checking the team's velocity from within Jira
fields.summary: support high-level roadmaps
Powerpoint export
Tell me which ressources i need to get it done by a certain date
help prioritize the backlog by different criteria everyone understands
